name: ListExistingIncidents
description:
Retrieve a list of existing incidents.

Fetches a list of incidents that represent problems needing resolution. Useful for monitoring and addressing ongoing issues.

parameters.name: accept_version_header
parameters.description: Specify the versioning for the API response using the Accept header.

value_schema.description: The `Accept` header is used as a versioning header.

parameters.name: content_type
parameters.description: Specify the media type of the request. Use 'application/json' for JSON payloads.

parameters.name: results_per_page
parameters.description: The number of results per page. Specify up to a maximum of 100.

value_schema.description: The number of results per page. Maximum of 100.

parameters.name: pagination_offset
parameters.description: Offset to start pagination of the incident search results. Specify the number of entries to skip before starting to collect the result set.

value_schema.description: Offset to start pagination search results.

parameters.name: ignore_since_until_date_range
parameters.description: Set to 'all' to ignore the 'since' and 'until' parameters, extending the search to all dates.

value_schema.description: When set to all, the since and until parameters and defaults are ignored.

parameters.name: incident_deduplication_key
parameters.description: A unique key to identify and retrieve specific incidents. Useful for querying by matching alert keys.

value_schema.description: Incident de-duplication key. Incidents with child alerts do not have an incident key; querying by incident key will return incidents whose alerts have alert_key matching the given incident key.

parameters.name: service_ids
parameters.description: A list of service IDs to filter incidents associated with specific services.

value_schema.description: Returns only the incidents associated with the passed service(s). This expects one or more service IDs.

parameters.name: filter_by_team_ids
parameters.description: Array of team IDs to filter incidents. Requires `teams` ability.

value_schema.description: An array of team IDs. Only results related to these teams will be returned. Account must have the `teams` ability to use this parameter.

parameters.name: assigned_user_ids
parameters.description: Return incidents currently assigned to specific users by providing their user IDs. Only incidents with statuses 'triggered' or 'acknowledged' are returned. Resolved incidents are not included.

value_schema.description: Returns only the incidents currently assigned to the passed user(s). This expects one or more user IDs. Note: When using the assigned_to_user filter, you will only receive incidents with statuses of triggered or acknowledged. This is because resolved incidents are not assigned to any user.

parameters.name: incident_urgencies
parameters.description: Array of incident urgencies to filter results by. Valid values are 'high' or 'low'. Defaults to all urgencies.

value_schema.description: Array of the urgencies of the incidents to be returned. Defaults to all urgencies. Account must have the `urgencies` ability to do this.

parameters.name: render_time_zone
parameters.description: Specify the time zone for rendering results. Defaults to the account time zone.

value_schema.description: Time zone in which results will be rendered. This will default to the account time zone.

parameters.name: incident_statuses
parameters.description: Specify the list of incident statuses to filter by, such as 'triggered', 'acknowledged', or 'resolved'.

value_schema.description: Return only incidents with the given statuses. To query multiple statuses, pass `statuses[]` more than once, for example: `https://api.pagerduty.com/incidents?statuses[]=triggered&statuses[]=acknowledged`. (More status codes may be introduced in the future.)

parameters.name: sort_incidents_by
parameters.description: Specify fields and directions for sorting incidents, e.g., 'created_at:asc'. Separate fields with a comma.

value_schema.description: Used to specify both the field you wish to sort the results on (incident_number/created_at/resolved_at/urgency), as well as the direction (asc/desc) of the results. The sort_by field and direction should be separated by a colon. A maximum of two fields can be included, separated by a comma. Sort direction defaults to ascending. The account must have the `urgencies` ability to sort by the urgency.

parameters.name: additional_details_to_include
parameters.description: Array of additional details to include in the incident list, such as 'acknowledgers', 'agents', 'assignees', etc.

value_schema.description: Array of additional details to include.

parameters.name: start_date_range
parameters.description: The start date to begin searching for incidents, within a 6-month range. Defaults to 1 month if not provided.

value_schema.description: The start of the date range over which you want to search. Maximum range is 6 months and default is 1 month.

parameters.name: end_date_range
parameters.description: The end date of the range for searching incidents. Maximum range is 6 months; default is 1 month.

value_schema.description: The end of the date range over which you want to search. Maximum range is 6 months and default is 1 month.

parameters.name: include_total_in_response
parameters.description: Set to true to include the total number of incidents in the response, which may reduce response speed.

value_schema.description:
By default the `total` field in pagination responses is set to `null` to provide the fastest possible response times. Set `total` to `true` for this field to be populated.

See our [Pagination Docs](https://developer.pagerduty.com/docs/rest-api-v2/pagination/) for more information.
